content:
Friends! Nobody can help me to test something on the windows app? Please?

Pls see #spell checker topic (BTW how can I type it here to create a link to it? Tried # with no success.

@Fl치vio Zarur Lucarelli please just post in the original topic, rather than making new ones. And see https://zulip.com/help/link-to-a-message-or-conversation for how to link.

You seem to have an issue with the spellchecker on Windows that nobody else has reported has can reproduce; I'm not sure we have a good way to debug that as the issue likely depends on some detail about your computer that is hard to guess. I don't think we have the resources to debug it with you individually, so I think the issue will remain a known bug until someone else can reproduce it (either another user reporting it or a developer figuring out how to).
If we have two users with the problem, we can at least try to cross-compare what is the same about their systems and use that to figure out things to test.

We don't have the resources to for free debug every weird issue that we can't reproduce and have only seen a single user report. If this issue is important to you, you can consider buying a support contract.

Hi, Tim, how are you? I have and I'm not getting responses.

But nobody tested in the windows app. ;)

I guess I'll open a bug report, is that Ok? All I'm asking is for someone to help me test in the windows app. Isn't that possible?

Thanks.

or at least nobody replies to me saying they can test it in the windows app. I believe I end up helping the product too, of course, that's also my goal, I have sent some good suggestions in your github, etc
